result.execSummary:
The defendant Aireyanna A Barkley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC AMENDED FROM PCS W/INTENT THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant may motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation and has no new contact with law enforcement.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Must obtain high school diploma or at a minimum obtain GED. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

timeConds.notes: to be completed during the term of probation

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Aireyanna A Barkley in court with attorney Erin J. Larsen.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Upon plea to amended charge to 3 cts pcs/thc as a misd. It is a stipulated agreement - 2 yrs prob; obtain hs diploma, 200 hrs csw, ft emp/school, aoda. The State stipulates to expungement if deft successfully completes probation and has no new contact with law enforcement.
P-NC to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above.  sent w/held - 2 yrs probation. Deft may motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation and has no new contacts with law enforcement.

Conditions:
200 hrs CSW
obey all rules and regs
costs/each count
DNA costs/each count
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA
FT emp/school
Must obtain HS diploma-at a minimum GED
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, meeting with atty, job interviews and if gains employment, can go to work. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 05-16-2014 - GPS MAY BE REMOVED
Plea hearing on July 18, 2014 at 09:30 am.
